text:
- What's up, bestie?
- Oh, I'm sorry.

Were you addressing me,
my sister from another mister?

- Oh, I was, my BFF.
- Glad to hear it...

- Missed an "ever."
- Dang it.
Close enough, though.

Because friends
forgive each other.
And best friends are the best
at forgiving each other.

There's not even
anything to forgive.

It's like, what were
we even talking about?

It's like,
whatever it was, gone now.

It's like, poof, be gone, minor
disagreement whatever you were.

It's like we finish
each other's...

What?
Finish each other's what?

Oh, hey, you two.
Sorry I'm late.

Are you guys celebrating
your friendship because

International Day Of The Girl
is coming up?

More like we're
celebrating our friendship

and International Day
Of The Girl is coming up.

More like
we don't need an excuse
to celebrate our friendship.

Yeah, because
there's so much to celebrate.

I like it.
Girls lifting up girls.

You love to see it.
You know what, though?

It feels like
this combo doesn't need me.

- So I'm going to bounce.
- Thanks, Trev.

- Later, Trev.
- Stay awesome, you two.

Chandler, you know
you can do anything
you put your mind to, right?

You know, I believe it
because you told me.
And not only do I believe you,

I believe you can do
anything you put your mind to.

Chandler, I celebrate what
a talented singer you are.

Ariel, I celebrate what
a talented dancer you are.

I celebrate that
we can support each other
without getting competitive.

I celebrate that
even more than you do.

Wait. Strike that last one.
Listen up, girls.

Do you have a bestie
that you maybe haven't

been able to hang out
with in awhile?
Why not give them a shout?

- Drop them a text.
- Get their back.

Let them know that
you've got their back.

- Because they've got yours.
- And they miss you.

- Like I miss you!
- I miss you more!

Happy, International Day
Of The Girl, Ariel.

Happy International Day
Of The Girl, Chandler.

- Aww.
- Look at us.
Stop it. You're so sweet.
